Specimen Type: Sputum, bronchial washings, tissue biopsies, body fluids, wound aspirates
Purpose: To cultivate, identify, and report Mycobacteria and Nocardia species from clinical specimens for accurate and timely diagnosis of related infections.
Container: Sterile, leak-proof specimen container (e.g., sterile screw-cap cup or tube) appropriately labeled
Equipment: Biosafety cabinet, centrifuge, vortex mixer, CO₂ incubator (37 °C), standard incubator (30 °C & 37 °C), Lowenstein-Jensen and Middlebrook 7H11 media, Brain Heart Infusion agar, selective media, acid-fast staining supplies
